text: while every dogs nose is pretty
sensational so for instance a tracking
dog who's following a person who has
gone missing and finds footsteps but
doesn't know which direction they're
going can tell which direction by the
difference in odor concentration of the
first and the fifth footstep so in other
words the first footstep will have
slightly less odor than the one they
took two seconds later the fifth
footstep and that's how they tell which
direction the person is gone so in that
way I think odor is actually telling
time for dogs it's telling them what was
here more recently or what's about to
arrive I can smell something on the wind
and what was here a long time ago a
smell that's lost concentration and is
diminishing on the ground so I think
that acuity and that ability to kind of
tell time with smell is pretty
astounding
[Music]
